page.title: 04Sites of interest
page.content: Along the banks of the Thames lies the historic site of Runnymede and there are two monuments there which are of particular interest to visitors. The Magna Carta Memorial.This commemorates the signing of the Magna Carta by King John in 1215. The Kennedy Memorial. This was erected to the memory of President J.F.Kennedy who was so tragically assassinated and is obviously of special interest to American visitors to this area. On the top of Coopers Hill lies the Air Force Memorial which was built in memory of all the British and Commonwealth airmen who so valiantly gave their lives in defence of freedom during the war.It is a place of special peace and tranquility looking down over the river.
